      • getMarkupModel

        MarkupModelEx getMarkupModel()
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Returns the markup model for the editor. This model contains editor-specific highlighters (for example, highlighters added by "Highlight usages in file"), which are painted in addition to the highlighters contained in the markup model for the document.

        See also DocumentMarkupModel.forDocument(Document, Project, boolean) getFilteredDocumentMarkupModel().

        Specified by:
        getMarkupModel in interface Editor
        Returns:
        the markup model instance.

      • getFilteredDocumentMarkupModel

        MarkupModelEx getFilteredDocumentMarkupModel()
        Returns the markup model for the underlying Document.

        This model differs from the one from DocumentMarkupModel#forDocument, as it does not contain highlighters that should not be visible in this Editor. (for example, debugger breakpoints in a diff viewer editors)

        Returns:
        the markup model instance.
        See Also:
        MarkupEditorFilter, EditorImpl.setHighlightingFilter(Condition), DocumentMarkupModel.forDocument(Document, Project, boolean)

      • createBoundColorSchemeDelegate

        EditorColorsScheme createBoundColorSchemeDelegate(EditorColorsScheme customGlobalScheme)
        Creates color scheme delegate which is bound to current editor. E.g. all schema changes will update editor state.

      • setPlaceholder

        void setPlaceholder(java.lang.CharSequence text)
        Allows to define 'placeholder text' for the current editor, i.e. virtual text that will be represented until any user data is entered. Feel free to see the detailed feature definition here.
        Parameters:
        text - virtual text to show until user data is entered or the editor is focused

      • setPlaceholderAttributes

        void setPlaceholderAttributes(TextAttributes attributes)
        Sets text attributes for a placeholder. Font style and color are currently supported. null means default values should be used.
        See Also:
        setPlaceholder(CharSequence)

      • setShowPlaceholderWhenFocused

        void setShowPlaceholderWhenFocused(boolean show)
        Controls whether 'placeholder text' is visible when editor is focused.
        Parameters:
        show - flag indicating whether placeholder is visible when editor is focused.
        See Also:
        setPlaceholder(CharSequence)

      • isStickySelection

        boolean isStickySelection()
        Allows to answer if 'sticky selection' is active for the current editor.

        'Sticky selection' means that every time caret position changes, selection end offset is automatically set to the same position. Selection start is always caret offset on setStickySelection(boolean) call with 'true' argument.

        Returns:
        true if 'sticky selection' mode is active at the current editor; false otherwise

      • setStickySelection

        void setStickySelection(boolean enable)
        Allows to set current sticky selection mode.
        Parameters:
        enable - flag that identifies if 'sticky selection' mode should be enabled

      • getPrefixTextWidthInPixels

        int getPrefixTextWidthInPixels()
        Returns:
        width in pixels of the prefix used with the current editor if any; zero otherwise

      • setPrefixTextAndAttributes

        void setPrefixTextAndAttributes(java.lang.String prefixText,
                                TextAttributes attributes)
        Allows to define prefix to be displayed on every editor line and text attributes to use for its coloring.
        Parameters:
        prefixText - target prefix text
        attributes - text attributes to use during given prefix painting

      • isPurePaintingMode

        boolean isPurePaintingMode()
        Returns:
        current 'pure painting mode' status
        See Also:
        setPurePaintingMode(boolean)

      • setPurePaintingMode

        void setPurePaintingMode(boolean enabled)
        We often re-use the logic encapsulated at the editor. For example, every time we show editor fragment (folding, preview etc) we create a dedicated graphics object and ask the editor to paint into it.

        The thing is that the editor itself may change its state if any postponed operation is triggered by the painting request (e.g. soft wraps recalculation is triggered by the paint request and newly calculated soft wraps cause caret to change its position).

        This method allows to inform the editor that all subsequent painting request should not change the editor state.

        In 'pure painting mode' editor also behaves as if soft wraps were not enabled.

        Parameters:
        enabled - 'pure painting mode' status to use

      • registerLineExtensionPainter

        void registerLineExtensionPainter(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.util.Collection<LineExtensionInfo>> lineExtensionPainter)
        Registers a function which will be applied to a line number to obtain additional text fragments. The fragments returned by the function will be drawn in the editor after end of the line (together with fragments returned by EditorLinePainter extensions).

      • registerScrollBarRepaintCallback

        void registerScrollBarRepaintCallback(ButtonlessScrollBarUI.ScrollbarRepaintCallback callback)
        Allows to register a callback that will be called one each repaint of the editor vertical scrollbar. This is needed to allow a parent component draw above the scrollbar components (e.g. in the merge tool), otherwise the drawings are cleared once the scrollbar gets repainted (which may happen suddenly, because the scrollbar UI uses the Animator to draw itself.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback which will be called from the JComponent.paint(Graphics) method of the editor vertical scrollbar.

      • getExpectedCaretOffset

        int getExpectedCaretOffset()
        Returns:
        the offset that the caret is expected to be but maybe not yet. This can be used in EditorMouseListener.mousePressed(EditorMouseEvent) implementation, as at the time this method is invoked caret wasn't yet moved to the press position. In other circumstances it's just equal to primary caret's offset.

      • setContextMenuGroupId

        void setContextMenuGroupId(java.lang.String groupId)
        Sets id of action group what will be used to construct context menu displayed by default editor popup handler on mouse right button's click (with null value disabling context menu). This method might have no effect if default editor's popup handler was overridden using installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler).
        See Also:
        getContextMenuGroupId()

      • getContextMenuGroupId

        java.lang.String getContextMenuGroupId()
        Returns id of action group what will be used to construct context menu displayed by default editor popup handler on mouse right button's click (null value meaning no context menu). Returned value might be meaningless if default editor's popup handler was overridden using installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler).
        See Also:
        setContextMenuGroupId(String)

      • installPopupHandler

        void installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler popupHandler)
        Allows to override default editor's context popup logic.

        Default handler shows a context menu corresponding to a certain action group registered in ActionManager. Group's id can be changed using setContextMenuGroupId(String). For inline custom visual elements (inlays) action group is determined by EditorCustomElementRenderer.getContextMenuGroupId(Inlay) and EditorCustomElementRenderer.getContextMenuGroup(Inlay).

        If multiple handlers are installed, they are processed in order, starting from the most recently installed one. Processing stops when some handler returns true from EditorPopupHandler.handlePopup(EditorMouseEvent) method.

        See Also:
        uninstallPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler)

      • uninstallPopupHandler

        void uninstallPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler popupHandler)
        Removes previously installed EditorPopupHandler.
        See Also:
        installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler)

      • setCustomCursor

        void setCustomCursor(java.lang.Object requestor,
                     java.awt.Cursor cursor)
        If cursor parameter value is not null, sets custom cursor to editor's content component, otherwise restores default editor cursor management logic (requestor parameter value should be the same in both setting and restoring requests). 'Restoring' call for a requestor, which hasn't set a cursor previously, has no effect. If multiple requestors have currently set custom cursors, one of them will be used (it is unspecified, which one).
